intro: Pithecellobium lehmannii, commonly known as the yellow pithecellobium, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, edible pods that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy, yellow aril. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some tropical regions.
